title: High ping in late game but not early game
body:
Hi,

I am having a strange issue with my ping at the moment. I have played 3 Games today and they have all been the same. I have been having a couple of ping spikes in the early game but a simple game restart will fix the issue (ping will drop back to normal), but later on in the game, restarting the game wont fix the issue and i am getting and average of 400-500ms.

Does anyone have any idea about why this is happening.

Thanks

replies.body:
Hey there,

Can you run through the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) and let me know if anything helps.

If nothing in the above guide helped, please perform the following.

* [Download WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/).
* Run a traceroute through WinMTR to the following IP address (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes).

>103.240.227.5

* Export the results as a textfile and post them _or_ attach a screenshot of your results, whichever is easiest for you.

I don't see any excessive packet loss. Could you please run a test on the [ICSI Netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) for me.

* Click on Start Analysis
* Wait until the analysis completes. This may take several minutes.
* Once the final result is displayed, copy the link in the address bar (and NOT the contents of the page) of your browser (see example below).
https://support.riotgames.com/attachments/token/9bmejvkuqxdyfuk/?name=netanalyzer.jpg
* Reply with the link to your netalyzr results.

It seems you're experiencing very high packet buffering on your connection.

**HERE ARE EXAMPLES OF COMMON APPLICATIONS/CAUSES WHICH INCREASE THE BUFFERING RATE (you should close these while playing league):**

* Skype
* Teamspeak
* Ventrillo
* Hamachi
* Spotify
* Anything that streams HD video content (i.e. Youtube, Twitch etc)
* Torrent programs (i.e. uTorrent)
* Active downloads (i.e Steam)

**You can alleviate the stress on your bandwidth by disabling Peer-to-Peer like this:**

* Open League of Legends Patcher.
* Click on Settings (Gears icon near the top right of the Patcher).
* Disable Peer-to-Peer Transfers.
* Save Settings.
* Restart PC.

**You can also take a step further and uninstall Pando Media Booster by doing the following:**

* Go to Start.
* Click on Control Panel.
* Go to All Programs (Add/Remove Programs in Windows XP)
* Uninstall Pando Media Booster.
* Restart the PC.
